comments.commentBody:
First we see attacks that Bernie is racist. Then we see attacks that he appointed a prominent, respected black activist.

First we see attacks that Bernie can't overcome antisemitism. Then we see attacks that he listens to Muslims respected in politics (Zogby) and in government (elected to the House of Representatives).

It looks likes somebody's talking points.
Thanks, Susan. And you're right.
I'm glad you could be there for her.  Radiation is a bear, but it can be a tolerable one.

And the DNC forced an honorable man, Joe Biden, out of getting into the race.   I do not believe a word of his story that he was too sad to run.   It was his son's dying wish that he run, and I am sure Joe would have honored that wish if DWS didn't put the kibash on it.

Trivial? If you did this at your job, and your company had a policy that e-mails only can be read and written on internal servers, you violate the policy; you are out of a job. If you had a government clearance job, your clearance would be revoked, you lose your job and be prosecuted fro a felony. This is no way "trivial".
I heard Hillary Clinton call Trump a loose cannon. If only. He's a pile of ammo going off one explosive after another after another. Last guy in the world we should have in the White House.

Such a beautifully written post. But then I got to Bernie, and the disconnect was startling. Lately, that part of the compass seems to me to have bought into the polarization.

That said, thank you for your fine thinking and writing. And I hope, at some point, you will realize that the world is just as complicated as you say, and it doesn't take one elderly uncompromising socialist, but all of us, working together, to solve this.

We have to: our climate is imploding!

"Neither he nor Hillary will get there with enough pledged delegates."  This is why rational people don't take Sanders and his acolytes seriously. No one really wants a President who apparently cannot add.
Bernie's wife and daughter's employment and pay are his Achilles heels.  He also does not play well with others in more ways than one.
One can only hope that the most fundamental drive - self-preservation - will kick-in for the DNC before it's too late. Supporting HRC at the convention will be to the bitterest of ends.

The problem for Hillary and the Democrats, if she is their nominee, is not her culpability or otherwise. It is that she will be running against a candidate who throws so much dirt that some of it is bound to stick.

Trump is just the latest and most effective member of the cottage industry that's been going after the Clintons for decades. Even though she is probably no more venal than most other politicians, Hillary has accumulated plenty of baggage over a long career, some real but most of it invented. It's just a fact of life that it will be used against her, and it should not be disqualifying. BUT - the Democratic Party's managers should have known better than to invest everything in a single candidate to win the White House rather than providing a level playing field for all willing candidates.

And that, dear readers, is why Bernie should go all the way to the convention. Neither he nor Hillary will get there with enough pledged delegates. The superdelegates may turn out to be a good idea after all, a safety valve of sorts. Depending on events between now and the convention, maybe enough of them will get cold feet and switch.

Mark:

So what? We need another space program: Tang is getting stale.

A few days ago I introduced the idea, tongue-in-cheek, of building space elevators tethered to satellites in geosynchronous orbits -- immense engines in the elevators would filter the atmosphere, returning it free of carbon, that would be compacted and launched from the top of the elevators on ballistic orbits into the sun. 50 year of this, no more global warming -- probably set us on a path to global weather control what with so much atmospheric movement. They eventually could be self-funding if you built-out the elevators and put casinos in them, the whales in the upper strata with the bodacious views, the blue-hairs closer to ground with their nickels and pennies.

Imagine the new technologies we'd need to develop to do something like this.

But, alas, we're all caught up in funding immense free cheese and Band-Aid factories instead, so we don't do great things anymore. Heck, we don't even effectively defend ourselves anymore.

We can overcome and mange the risks, Mark. That's only a small part of what American exceptionalism means, if we have the stones to re-validate it for OUR generations.

Let's hope that this affecting people with disabilities gets these crazy bathroom laws thrown out even sooner.  When our daughter was little she went to the men's room with her dad at times.  It should not be a bone of contention for anyone.

You don't seem to understand. We hate DT more than anything, but a Clinton nomination means he will be president - an unthinkable fate for America and the world. Her private email server matters is that she used it to avoid scrutiny and most likely conduct corrupt activity - like the favours she granted countries such as Saudi Arabia who had donated generously to the Clinton Foundation. And when asked for her emails by the FBI, she wiped 30,000 of them (a federal crime). She lied about having permission to have a private email server, as revealed yesterday. She's breached American national security, top secret information, and may have caused the failure of US operations - and loss of American lives - in the process. She is corrupt, dangerous, and a liar. She is still lying. She always lies. Meanwhile, there's an honest and trustworthy Democratic candidate who would be a wonderful president waiting in the wings.

It's not necessarily about the emails but more about her setting up a personal server. Also, her blatant lies about the whole issue..."I'll speak to anyone who wants to discuss...". Anyone except the IG investigating...
She is a wholesale liar. Need proof? Well, there's this, and the whole ducking under fire in Bosnia, no one died in Libya comment...I could go on and on...

"What do people want Ms. Hillary Rodham Clinton to do?"

1. Stop lying. 2. Drop out of race for president.

WHAT do people want Ms. Hillary Rodham Clinton to do?  Slit her wrists or commit suicide some other way.  The world is aghast that DT is spewing lies, hate, anger, war and terror - calling everyone he disagrees contemptible names - being totally uncivil and gross with no accountability and the press is talking about E-MAILS?  It is simply ludicrous.

Given the audience in North Dakota there is little surprise that he would advocate fossil fuels. If the audience were seeking the use of renewable energy he would be an advocate of that. And yet his supporters reiterate time and again that Trump is not a politician. After a year of campaigning, shifting his stance daily, sometimes hourly one must concede that what we have is just  another lying politician ?

Yep.  Tell that to those of us with solar panels on our roofs already.  We just paid nothing--for the third month in a row--for power and even got a little bit of a credit.  This country could create a lot of good paying jobs updating our woefully outdated power infrastructure and by decentralizing it.  People who actually know about energy and how it works know that it's the better way to go.  The fossil fuel companies just don't want to get off the dole.
If Trump knew that, he would quit the race. His entire campaign is based on delusions. Chief among these delusions is that, as president, he'll control the world.
How long do you think it would be before Hillary ordered out the troops somewhere?

How long do you think it would take for Trump to send the US and World economies into a recession / depression and launch a full invasion of at least one Middle Eastern country if elected President? Bet he could do it in 6 months or less.

Wrong.  The planet receives enough energy from the sun in one hour to power everything on Earth for an entire year.  What we should be doing is creating a world-wide electric grid powered around the globe by solar panels so that the planet can run everything on zero emission electricity and never burn another drop of fossil fuel - including coal, oil and natural gas.  Electric heat in our homes, massive electric public transportation and all-electric cars, all powered by the sun, with no atmospheric emissions.  We need to think BIG to save the planet for all.

Sane economic policy, energy policy, educational policy, foreign policy, is what we need.
We do not need an openly racist, misogynistic, narcissistic, megalomaniacal, nutcase as President.

Dump Trump 2016
Buffoon Trump is an embarrassment to his Trump Tower. Its foundations must be trembling hearing all the nonsense policies he keeps spewing to get elected.

I hope I am in a dream and will wake up tomorrow to realize I did not after all move to another country. Donald Trump is not a drunk rodeo clown but rather a ticking time bomb set on destroying the first real inflection point on the global warming trend line.
Wow, I didn't think anyone else had read Trump's economic policy proposal. One would think more people would since it is just that one sentence.

Folks:
Trump is a reality show actor and the American Presidency is now a reality show.

Trump doesn't have to know anything. He just has to have a starring role, and alot of money. He can be ignorant because he is cognizant of ratings. He does not need to ground any platform in facts, or research, or science, because (again), this is a reality show, made for TV. The reality show star determines who is right, who is a loser, who is little, and who is lying and crooked.

His thoughts on a Trump-Bernie debate are perfect for him: the ratings will be high, and some network will pay alot for it. Further, he can exclude his rival actress (Clinton) which is great in the ratings war.

I now think American will elect this reality show star/clown because he appeals to their entertainment. Rather than actually do something about anthropomorphic climate change, people can sit on their butts burning oil, or drive as big a gas guzzler as possible because the reality show clown/president will simply change the script so there isn't a disaster on HIS reality show/circus.

As long as Trump is the center ring, being the Ringmaster in Chief, barking out clever insults and phrases, everyone will have popcorn and beer and cotton candy; losers can be ridiculed or maybe even thrown to some lions which will delight the mob.

Who will be the Clown-In-Chiefs running mate? Simon? Ryan Seacrest? Jerry Springer? Someone to complement the Circus-Barker-in-Chief.

It's been that way for a long time - going back to when we got off the boat and started grabbing the natives' land, importing slaves, ripping up ecosystems, later on invading other countries basically for their resources and to protect the investments of the big money crowd (we didn't tell poor folk who did the actual fighting).

You might want to check Charles Dickens opinion of Americans formed when he visited in the 1840's. He saw us as armed and violent and only keen on talking about making money.

Indeed. I thought no one could be more embarrassing than Reagan.

Then there was George W Bush. Surely that was the lowest bar possible.

Yet both of these terribly inept and backward-looking men served two terms.

Now we have Trump.

I am genuinely terrified.

Does anyone else feel ashamed of America that someone like Trump can make it to be a Presidential candidate? Really, I'm serious. I've noticed that at least 5 nights w/i the past 2 weeks, I've had nightmares about Trump. Literally, I promise. It's causing me anxiety.

I can't believe this is my country, America, land of the arrogant and stupid, but still the land that I love.

Wouldn't the planet, and the the agreement that climate change could alter human life sooner than we believe, be worth the minuscule amount of resources that would be needed to help every single family make the adjustments for their immediate needs, as we change to clean energy. Provide monies for education, health care, housing and a guarantied salaries till the job is done. I understand people are proud and won't want hand outs but they would be doing a service to every living organism on this planet.
Plus taking into consideration all the new money that will be spent on rising sea levels, lost agricultural land, the suffering from drought conditions, etc.
For Americans getting behind a plan to do something along these lines would be a high form of serving the greater good, a new form of patriotism that most Americans I believe would embrace.
Lets show American resolve to the world without relying military power or electing an infantile school yard bully to the White House!

I can't stand Donald Drumpf and truly believe he is too ignorant to become the president and therefore will not. When this is all over he will crawl back to realty TV; thank God. But what about his supporters? They are our neighbors, relatives, co-workers, and they are in our lives. They are not going anywhere, and that's scary. These people are so obviously self-destructive that I fear them. That's how extreme my reaction is to Drumpf and Drumpf supporters. If those folks are so hellbent on self-destructing, well so be it. But I wouldn't allow

Donald Trump obviously knows nothing about the environment and even if he did, he'd be too selfish to care. He spews out whatever he thinks people in front of him want to hear. His plans to undo the urgently needed environmental help that has been carefully put in place are dangerous and inexcusable. This man must not win the election. He's an embarrassment to the USA and a genuine danger for multiple reasons. Please, anyone who agrees, do whatever you can to keep him out of the White House. Help get people out to vote. Vote blue, no matter who. Shame on Donald Trump.

Jose:

The Republican's started the Trillion dollar war in Iraq, not the Democrats. President Obama has avoided doing exactly what you accuse him of for almost eight years. Obama didn't bring instability to the Middle East, Bush did by lying us into a war in Iraq.

Trump is talking about something he cant possibly do. Not sure that counts as actually thinking about job creation. The future is in investing in clean energy which is the fastest growing segment of the energy industry.

Where is Trump's jobs bill? Obama had one that would have improved the nations infrastructure. The Republican's in Congress never let it come to a vote. Where is Trump's support for increasing minimum wage? Both Democrats support it.

Trump is lying to the working man to get his vote.
